title: [Health] Particulate air pollution cuts global average life expectancy by 2.2 years. This impact on life expectancy is comparable to that of smoking, more than three times that of alcohol use and unsafe water, six times that of HIV/AIDS, and 89 times that of conflict and terrorism.
